page.title: 10ILLNESS IN NASSINGTON.
page.content: After our survey of parents and children of Nassington school in the past year we found that many people had had influenza.They stayed in bed and took pills like Disprin or Paracetamol.Others had tonsilitis and took antibiotics.A number seem to have problems with their bones-hip pain, slipped discs,knee cartilage trouble and a few bad back aches.Their treatment was to have surgery or be careful and stay in bed.The commonest illness is really the common cold which everyone seems to get at least once a year.At school we have had people away with tummy bugs,sickness, mumps and chicken pox.Many people have hayfever at present.Illnesses lasted for periods of between one week for things like flu and a whole year for back pain.Most people go to KingsCliffe surgery then Wansford or Oundle.
